topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack 1.1: Monitor Health of Services using Icinga

body.p: Cloud admins can use the Icinga service running in the undercloud to monitor the health status of Account, Container, Proxy, and Object services.

ul.li: HP Helion OpenStack cloud is successfully deployed.(Starter Swift nodes are functional by default as they are part of cloud deployment.)
The Icinga service is active and running in the undercloud.

section.title: Monitoring the Health of Swift Services
section.p: You can monitor the health status of the swift-proxy, swift-account, swift-container and swift-object services by following these steps:

li.p: In the undercloud Horizon dashboard, log in to the Icinga Dashboard (http://<Undercloud_IP>/icinga/). The default login credentials are as follows:

Click Status on the left panel and then click
Host Detail
.

In the Host column, click the icon next to the host IP when the tooltip displays as "View Service Details For This Host". The page navigates to Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address >and displays the health status of the selected Swift node.

ol.li: Click the Swift node IP address to open the Service Status Details For Host <Swift node IP address> to view the health status of the selected Swift node.

row.entry: Service is temporarily disabled. The proxy-server is disabled by the creation of a file in the disable_path configuration parameter. This is often used to temporarily disable a proxy server by removing it from the load balancer or high availability system. Delete the file indicated in the disable_path configuration parameter to resolve it.
The named server is not responding. The process may not be running or may be stuck in some way. Start or restart the server to resolve it.
